primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must break the power of money (idolatry) by grasping the principle of 'scattering to gather' through the lens of Christ's sacrifice.

tekstueel_bewijs: how we can break the power of money over our lives
you go do the same thing. Scatter your gifts.

object.identificatie: Freedom from money's power / True Generosity
tekstueel_bewijs: how to break that power over us
become a generous church and generous people

zender.identificatie: The Gospel / The Cross of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: The gospel brings about a radical change
the cross is the ultimate example of that principle

ontvanger.identificatie: The Community / The Poor / The Believer
tekstueel_bewijs: advantage and build up the community
you through his poverty might become rich

helper.identificatie: The Cross / The Name of the Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: bring it into your heart through the cross of Jesus Christ
The name of the Lord is a fortified tower

tegenstander.identificatie: Money as a False God / The Insecure Heart
tekstueel_bewijs: Money offers to be your god
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Money is treated not just as currency but as a 'fortified city' and a 'divine' rival to God that demands sacrifice.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Christ (S) scatters himself (O) to gather humanity (Receiver).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (Soteriology) provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (power) for the primary program (Ethics).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Cross → The Believer ← The Idol of Wealth

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we use money to give ourselves an identity
you should be giving away so much

voorbeelden: you should be giving away so much
it's very appropriate... for Christians to give some attention
make you want to give more away
we’re going to learn three things
understand the words righteous and wicked
how we can break the power of money

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on how the hearer can 'be able' to be generous by changing their source of security.

primaire_tegenstelling.s2: The Fortified City of Wealth (False Security)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Wealth) to ~S1 (Vulnerability/Wrath) to S1 (Christ's Security) to ~S2 (Generosity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by showing that Christ took the ultimate 'scattering' (poverty/death) to provide the 'gathering' (wealth/life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; wealth is presented as a deceptive, hollowing power.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon has many 'you' subjects, it explicitly states that human effort cannot break the power of money; only the 'indicative' of the Cross provides the 'imperative' of generosity.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: you should be giving away so much that there’s a measurable sacrifice

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ is the only treasure who sacrificed for you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as models; rather, the 'Righteous' and 'Wicked' are used as categories of heart-orientation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The 'Righteous' person is seen as a result of the Gospel, not a hero to emulate by will.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-justification through wealth.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a fruit of justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon tightly integrates the wisdom of Proverbs with the theology of the Cross.
spanning_punten: The transition from Old Testament 10% to New Testament 'sacrifice' can feel like a new Law.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ was scattered in order to gather us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Cross' acts as the agent of change rather than the person of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an 'abomination' and a 'false god' that destroys the soul.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God/Christ as the ultimate Subject of the 'saving' action, making human generosity a response.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as 'The one who must break the power'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as 'The one whose power is broken by Christ'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Use more passive verbs regarding the heart's change.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the Spirit enables the sacrifice that the Law requires.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of Christocentric preaching from the Old Testament wisdom literature.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'three points' structure; Greimas reveals the 'Subject-switch' from the hearer to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew 'abomination'; Greimas explains how that 'abomination' functions as a narrative Opponent.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fortified City' is a rival Sender of values.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Scattering/Gathering' semiotic opposition to bridge the gap between Proverbs and the Cross.
